titleStmt.title: At Edinburgh, the twelfth day of July, one thousand six hundred and sixty five. Forasmuch as the sickness and plague in the City of London, suburbs thereof, and places near adjacent thereto, doth daily increase and break out in several towns and villages of the kingdom of England ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Privy Council.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Evan Tyler, Printer to the King's most excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Royal arms at head of text; initial letter.
Signed at end: Pet. Wedderburne, Cl. Sti. Concilii.
In ms. under title: "Anent the pestilence."
Halts trade with London and other infected places in England until 1 Nov. 1665.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
